title: Authors and Citation
text: Stefano Bergamini. Author, maintainer. Luca Lalli. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Bergamini S, Lalli L (2025). TemplateLandS: LaTeX template report. R package version 1.0.1, https://stheberga.github.io/TemplateLandS/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {TemplateLandS: LaTeX template for report},   author = {Stefano Bergamini and Luca Lalli},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 1.0.1},   url = {https://stheberga.github.io/TemplateLandS/}, }

title: LaTeX template for report
text: ready--use template package creating statistical reports.

title: LaTeX template for report
text: TemplateLandS designed streamline creation statistical reports. package provides ready--use template generating customizable, easy--read reports. particularly suited statistical analysis, including survival analysis patient datasets, well univariate multivariate statistical analyses.

title: LaTeX template for report
text: can install latest version TemplateLandS directly GitHub using devtools:
code: # Install devtools if not already installed install.packages("devtools")  # Install TemplateLandS devtools::install_github("StheBerga/TemplateLandS")

title: LaTeX template for report
text: installing package, need restart R access template. create new R Markdown file utilizing TemplateLandS, navigate File -> New File -> R Markdown. resulting window, choose “Template,” select “LandS LaTeX Report {TemplateLandS}” options right.

title: LaTeX template for report
text: Ready--use template statistical report generation Includes predefined chunks survival analysis patient datasets Supports univariate multivariate statistical analyses Customizable layout content options reports Export reports various formats (HTML, PDF, Word)

title: LaTeX template for report
text: Contributions, bug reports, feature suggestions welcome! Please open issue submit pull request repository.

title: LaTeX template for report
text: TemplateLandS distributed MIT license. See LICENSE file details.

title: Customized R Markdown Document — TemplateLandS
text: TemplateLandS() main function TemplateLandS package. Use output: TemplateLandS::TemplateLandS R Markdown YAML header.

title: Customized R Markdown Document — TemplateLandS
text: ... Passed rmarkdown::pdf_document().

title: Customized R Markdown Document — TemplateLandS
text: R Markdown output format pass rmarkdown::render().

title: Corporate Design: Format Date — cd_format_date
text: Format date local language format

title: Corporate Design: Format Date — cd_format_date
text: date Current date lang Language, either "de-DE", "de-CH" "en_US"

title: Corporate Design: Format Date — cd_format_date
text: Character string, date local format

title: Corporate Design: Format Date — cd_format_date
code: cd_format_date("2012-01-01", "de-DE") #> Warning: OS reports request to set locale to "de_DE" cannot be honored #> [1] " 1. January 2012" cd_format_date("2012-01-01", "en-US") #> Warning: OS reports request to set locale to "en_US" cannot be honored #> [1] "January  1, 2012"

what: Corporate Design: knitr Chunk Options — cd_knit_chunk_opts
title: Corporate Design: knitr Chunk Options — cd_knit_chunk_opts
text: Set knitr chunk options accordance corporate design.

title: Corporate Design: knitr Chunk Options — cd_knit_chunk_opts
code: cd_knit_chunk_opts(   twocolumn = default(rmarkdown::metadata$twocolumn, FALSE),   fig.width = NULL,   fig.height = NULL,   fig.pos = "h",   message = FALSE,   echo = FALSE )

title: Corporate Design: knitr Chunk Options — cd_knit_chunk_opts
text: twocolumn Use two-column mode? affect fig.width fig.height. fig.width Figure width. NULL, automatically chosen based twocolumn. fig.height Figure height NULL, automatically chosen based twocolumn. fig.pos Floating modifier figures message messages shown? echo echo shown?

title: Corporate Design: knitr Chunk Options — cd_knit_chunk_opts
text: function called side effects returns NULL, invisibly.

title: Corporate Design: knitr Chunk Options — cd_knit_chunk_opts
Corporate Design: Title Page — cd_page_title
text: Example function generate title page

title: Corporate Design: Title Page — cd_page_title
code: cd_page_title(   studytitle = default(rmarkdown::metadata$studytitle, "Study title"),   reporttitle = default(rmarkdown::metadata$reporttitle, "Report title"),   date = default(rmarkdown::metadata$date, format(Sys.Date(), ("%d-%m-%Y"))),   department = default(rmarkdown::metadata$department, "Your Department"),   unit = default(rmarkdown::metadata$unit, "Your research Unit"),   authorone = default(rmarkdown::metadata$authorone, "First author"),   roleone = default(rmarkdown::metadata$roleone, "First author role"),   emailone = default(rmarkdown::metadata$emailone, "name.surname@email.com"),   authortwo = default(rmarkdown::metadata$authortwo, "Second author"),   roletwo = default(rmarkdown::metadata$roletwo, "Second author role"),   emailtwo = default(rmarkdown::metadata$emailtwo, "name.surname@email.com"),   authorthree = default(rmarkdown::metadata$authorthree, "Third author"),   rolethree = default(rmarkdown::metadata$rolethree, "Third author role"),   emailthree = default(rmarkdown::metadata$emailthree, "name.surname@email.com"),   authorfour = default(rmarkdown::metadata$authorfour, "Fourth author"),   rolefour = default(rmarkdown::metadata$rolefour, "Fourth author role"),   emailfour = default(rmarkdown::metadata$emailfour, "name.surname@email.com"),   tableofcontents = default(rmarkdown::metadata$tableofcontents, "true"),   tocname = default(rmarkdown::metadata$tocname, "Table of Contents"),   tocdepth = default(rmarkdown::metadata$tocdepth, "2"),   linestretchtable = default(rmarkdown::metadata$linestretchtable, "0.8"),   linestretch = default(rmarkdown::metadata$linestretch, "1.5") )

title: Corporate Design: Title Page — cd_page_title
text: date Document creation date title Document title subtitle Document subtitle

title: Corporate Design: Title Page — cd_page_title
text: Object class "knit_asis" (knitr treat ). LaTeX code title page.

title: Corporate Design: Title Page — cd_page_title
code: cd_page_title(   title = "My Title",   subtitle = "My Subtitle" ) #> Error in cd_page_title(title = "My Title", subtitle = "My Subtitle"): unused arguments (title = "My Title", subtitle = "My Subtitle")

title: Set Default Value — default
text: Set default value argument. x NULL, default used.

title: Set Default Value — default
text: x Character string, NULL default x NULL, default used.

title: Set Default Value — default
text: Character string

title: Set Default Value — default
code: default(NULL) #> [1] "" default(NULL, "my default") #> [1] "my default" default("a string", "my default") #> [1] "a string"

what: Glue LaTeX Code for Use in R Markdown — indiedown_glue
title: Glue LaTeX Code for Use in R Markdown — indiedown_glue
text: Use function wrap literal LaTeX code R. Use raw string input (r"()") automatically escape quotes backslashes, common LaTeX. Expressions enclosed << >> evaluated R code.

title: Glue LaTeX Code for Use in R Markdown — indiedown_glue
Glue LaTeX Code for Use in R Markdown — indiedown_glue
text: x Character, often raw string (r"()") .open, .close opening closing delimiter.

title: Glue LaTeX Code for Use in R Markdown — indiedown_glue
text: Object class "knit_asis" (knitr treat ). Usually LaTeX code.

title: Glue LaTeX Code for Use in R Markdown — indiedown_glue
text: indiedown_glue() uses different default underlying glue::glue() (<< >>), braces common LaTeX. Doubling full delimiter (<<<< >>>>) escapes .

title: Glue LaTeX Code for Use in R Markdown — indiedown_glue
code: x <- "something" indiedown_glue(r"(\LaTeX\ code with <<x>> substituted )") #> [1] "\\LaTeX\\ code with something substituted " #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "knit_asis" #> attr(,"knit_cacheable") #> [1] NA

title: Path helpers — indiedown_path
text: indiedown_path() creates path package's indiedown assets, located inst/indiedown. indiedown_path_tex() creates path usable LaTeX, special characters escaped.

title: Path helpers — indiedown_path
text: ... Path components, passed system.file().

title: Path helpers — indiedown_path
text: Character string, path package's indiedown assets

title: Render R Markdown — knit_LB
text: Render input file specific output folder. Output folder exist rendered folder input file.

title: Render R Markdown — knit_LB
text: input input file rendered. can R script (.R), R Markdown document (.Rmd), plain markdown document. ... Additional arguments passed rmarkdown::render function.

title: Render R Markdown — knit_LB
text: run_pandoc = TRUE, compiled document written output file, path output file returned. run_pandoc = FALSE, path Markdown output file, attributes knit_meta (knitr meta data collected code chunks) intermediates (intermediate files/directories generated render()).

title: Render R Markdown — knit_LB
text: can also setup knit function YAML header R Markdown file. See example .

title: Render R Markdown — knit_LB
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(rmarkdown)  # Render the default (first) format defined in the file render("input.Rmd") } # }
